briefTitle: Immunogenicity and Safety of Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine (NBP607-QIV) in Adults and Elderly Subjects

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults aged 19 years and older
* Those who are able to comply with the requirements for the study
* If women, a negative pregnancy test and willingness to use birth control measures for the entire study duration

Exclusion Criteria:

* Disorders in immune function
* Any malignancy or lymphoproliferative disorder
* History of Guillain-Barré syndrome
* Individuals with a known bleeding diathesis, or any condition that may be associated with a prolonged bleeding time
* Experience of fever (\>38.0 ℃) within 24 hours following vaccination
* Body temperature \>38.0 ℃ at the vaccination day
* Concomitant medications/therapy such as immunosuppressants or immune modifying drugs, systemic corticosteroids, immunoglobulins, blood or blood- derived products within 3 months
* Influenza vaccination within 6 months
* Subjects who have participated in other interventional study within 4 weeks
* Any vaccination within 1 month
* Those who are planning to receive any vaccine within 1 month from the study vaccine
* Individuals with any serious chronic or progressive disease
* Pregnant or breast-feeding women
* Any other reason that in the opinion of the investigator might interfere with the study

outcomeMeasures.title: Geometric Mean HI Titers (GMTs) After Vaccination in All Subjects
outcomeMeasures.description:
GMTs of anti-influenza antibodies were measured for 4 strains: A/H1N1, A/H3N2, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. For each A strain, the titers were made with the pooled TIV group (NBP60-Y and NBP607-V).

For each A strain, the comparion was made with the pooled TIV groups (Y+V/QIV). For each B strain, the comparison was made with the corresponding TIV group(i.e. for B/Yamagata, Geometric Mean Titer Ratio (GMR) is Y/QIV).

outcomeMeasures.title: Seroconversion Rate (SCR) After Vaccination in All Subjects
outcomeMeasures.description:
SCR was measured for 4 strains: A/H1N1, A/H3N2, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. Seroconversion was defined as the proportion of subjects who met either (1) post-vaccination HI titer of ≥ 1:40 for subjects with pre-vaccination HI titer of \<1:10 or (2) Four-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer for subjects with pre-vaccination HI titer of ≥ 1:10

For each A strain, the comparion was made with the pooled TIV groups (Y+V minus QIV). For each B strain, the comparison was made with the corresponding TIV group(i.e. for B/Yamagata, Difference of SCR (Diff.SCR) is Y minus QIV).

outcomeMeasures.title: Seroprotection Rate (SPR) of NBP607-QIV in the Elderly Subject Aged ≥60 Years
outcomeMeasures.description: SPR of NBP607-QIV was measured for 4 strains: A/H1N1, A/H3N2, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. Seroprotection was defined as the proportion of subjects whose post-vaccination HI titer increased to ≥1:40.

outcomeMeasures.title: Seroconversion Rate (SCR) of NBP607-QIV in the Elderly Subject Aged ≥60 Years
outcomeMeasures.description: SCR was measured for 4 strains: A/H1N1, A/H3N2, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. Seroconversion was defined as the proportion of subjects who met either (1) post-vaccination HI titer of ≥ 1:40 for subjects with pre-vaccination HI titer of \<1:10 or (2) Four-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer for subjects with pre-vaccination HI titer of ≥ 1:10

outcomeMeasures.title: Geometric Mean Ratio (GMR) of NBP607-QIV in the Elderly Subject Aged ≥60 Years
outcomeMeasures.description: GMR was measured for 4 strains: A/H1N1, A/H3N2, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. GMR was defined as the fold-rise of the geometric mean HI titer from pre- to post-vaccination.

outcomeMeasures.title: Geometric Mean HI Titers (GMTs) of Each B Strain After Vaccination in All Subjects
outcomeMeasures.description:
GMTs of anti-influenza antibodies were measured for B strains: B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata.

For each B strain, the comparison was made with the TIV group which did not contain the correponding B strain (i.e. for B/Yamagata, Geometric Mean Titer Ratio (GMR) is V/QIV).

outcomeMeasures.title: Seroconversion Rate (SCR) of B Strain After Vaccination in All Subjects
outcomeMeasures.description: SCR was measured for each B strain: B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. Seroconversion was defined as the proportion of subjects who met either (1) post-vaccination HI titer of ≥ 1:40 for subjects with pre-vaccination HI titer of \<1:10 or (2) Four-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer for subjects with pre-vaccination HI titer of ≥ 1:10

outcomeMeasures.title: Seroprotection Rate (SPR) of NBP607-QIV in the Adults Aged 19 to 59 Years
outcomeMeasures.description: SPR of NBP607-QIV was measured for 4 strains: A/H1N1, A/H3N2, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. Seroprotection was defined as the proportion of subjects whose post-vaccination HI titer increased to ≥1:40.

outcomeMeasures.title: Seroconversion Rate (SCR) of NBP607-QIV in the Adults Aged 19 to 59 Years
outcomeMeasures.description: SCR was measured for 4 strains: A/H1N1, A/H3N2, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. Seroconversion was defined as the proportion of subjects who met either (1) post-vaccination HI titer of ≥ 1:40 for subjects with pre-vaccination HI titer of \<1:10 or (2) Four-fold increase in post-vaccination HI titer for subjects with pre-vaccination HI titer of ≥ 1:10

outcomeMeasures.title: Geometric Mean Ratio (GMR) of NBP607-QIV in the Subjects Aged 19 to 59 Years
outcomeMeasures.description: GMR was measured for 4 strains: A/H1N1, A/H3N2, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata. GMR was defined as the fold-rise of the geometric mean HI titer from pre- to post-vaccination
